Description: Fragment of a vessel: in transparent sapphire-blue glass apparently from the neck of a vessel as the core has been removed. Impressed into the surface at irregular intervals, prefabricated 'eyes' of opaque white circles with black centres surrounded by an orange line. On some 'eyes' an additional black thread has been inserted.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Bibliography: R. Freed, 'Pharaohs of the Sun', (Boston 2000), p. 266 [216] (wrongly numbered as EA 68392). R. Freed, 'Farao's van de Zon', (Leiden 2000), p. 266 [216] (wrongly numbered as EA 68392).
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1999 14 Nov-2000 6 Feb, USA, Boston, Museum of Fine Arts, Pharaohs of the Sun : Akhenaten Nefertiti Tutakhamen
